news-item.title: Oman Cables Industry in its biggest trailing week loss for 7 months
news-item.source: News Bites - Middle East and North Africa: Oman
news-item.text:
Oman Cables Industry (MSM:OCAI), Oman's largest industrial company by market capitalisation, decreased 1.50 Baisa (or 0.6%) to close at OMR2.43. In the past week the shares have dropped 3.6%, the biggest trailing week fall since September 08. Compared with the Muscat Securities Market Index which fell 58.2 points (or 0.8%) in the day, this represented a relative price increase of 0.2%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on Oman Cables Industry, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/00105144177031494 Bearish Signals- The price decreased 0.4% in the last month. The stock has been exacerbated by firm volume of 1.2 times average for the month. Overbought/Bearish/Resistance Signals- The Money Flow Index [MFI] is 82.8 suggesting an overbought 14-day trend, being above 80. The Money Ratio of 4.8 suggests positive money flow was 4.8 times negative money flow.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price/Earnings of 12.9 [11.2]. - Price/Sales of 0.7 [0.5]. - Price to Book of 3.7 [1.9].Other Bearish Signals:- Total Liabilities/ EBITDA of 5.3 is more than or equal to 5, this compares unfavourably with the Joseph Piotroski benchmark of 5. - Net profit margin has averaged 3.9% in the last 3 years. This suggests the company is less profitable with a low margin of safety.- Net Profit margin is positive but falling in recent quarters.[Quarter ended, all figures in %]
Bullish Signals- The 3.6% discount to 12-month high of OMR2.52 against the 72.3% premium to 12-month low of OMR1.41 suggests the stock continues to push for new highs. - In the last three months the stock has hit a new 52-week high fifteen times, pointing to a significant uptrend. - The present value of OMR1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in Oman Cables Industry is OMR1,676, for a capital gain of OMR676. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Return on Equity 22.0% [16.5%].- Return on Assets 8.8% [4.3%].- Return on Capital Employed 22.4% [14.2%].Other Bullish Signals:- Interest cover defined by EBIT/I is 13.9 times. This indicates it is less leveraged. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 1.5. Compared with the rest of the market the stock is undervalued.- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity is high at 22.0%. This is computed as net profit margin of 5.0% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 1.8 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 2.5. Also, this has improved from 14.6% last year. - Net Profit margin, EBIT margin and EBITDA margin are positive and have seen consecutive rises in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
NoteVolume: there were 177,300 shares worth OMR430,839 (US$1.1 million) traded. This has been exacerbated by robust volume of 2.2 times average. Beta: the Beta of Oman Cables Industry stock is 1.6. A Beta greater than 1 suggests this is a high risk, high return stock with volatility greater than that of the market.
